ticTacToe

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • ticTacToe.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a class that defines the environment of a Tic Tac Toe Game: its underlying state representation, actions transitions etc. It also provides functionality for playing out a game between two agents, various other useful methods.
    Author:
    ae187

      • getAllSuccessorGames

        public java.util.List<Game> getAllSuccessorGames()
        Returns:
        All possible next game states from the current game state in one step where the agent whose turn it is moves.

      • generateAllValidGames

        public static java.util.List<Game> generateAllValidGames(char xo)
        A static method to generate all valid game states where it is either X's turn or O's turn as specified by xo argument. NOTE: this method will include ALL terminal states in the game.
        Parameters:
        xo - specifies whose turn it should be in the resulting games.
        Returns:

      • getPossibleMoves

        public java.util.List<Move> getPossibleMoves()
        returns a list of all available moves by the agent whose turn it is.
        Returns:

      • getPossibleMovesByOpponent

        public java.util.List<Move> getPossibleMovesByOpponent()
        returns a list of all available moves by the agent whose turn it is NOT. Used by the defensive agent.
        Returns:

      • simulateMove

        public Game simulateMove(char who,
                         int x,
                         int y)
                  throws IllegalMoveException
        Executes move on the current game. Returns the resulting game without changing the current one.
        Parameters:
        who - the agent making move (X or O)
        x - the x coordinate of the move (between 0 and 2 inclusive)
        y - the y coordinate of the move
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException

        Returns:

                        int x,
                        int y)

        x - the x coordinate of the move (between 0 and 2 inclusive)
        y - the y coordinate of the move (between 0 and 2 inclusive)

      • playOut

        public void playOut()
             throws IllegalMoveException

      • clone

        public Game clone()
        Deep copy
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        A hashCode function implemented assuming the game board is a 10 digit number in base three, where: ' ' maps to 0 'X' maps to 1 'O' maps to 2 10 digits instead of 9 because we used the last, 10th one to encode whose turn it is. The returned value is essentially that number converted to base 10. You can use this method to store (e.g. write to file) your value functions or policies.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        an integer representation of the game

      • inverseHash

        public static Game inverseHash(int hash)
        Given a hash value for a game according to hashCode() this method turns it back into a Game object, i.e. it is the inverse of the hashCode method. You can use this method to read your policy or value functions from file.
        Parameters:
        hash -
        Returns:
        the Game corresponding to the hash
